channel.title: Pinch of Code
channel.description: Recent content on Pinch of Code

item.title: EV Charging: OCPP 2.0.1: Major Advancement from OCPP 1.6 üîã
item.description:
EV Charging: OCPP 2.0.1: Major Advancement from OCPP 1.6 üîã

OCPP 1.6 has been widely adopted in EV charging infrastucture and customer business management. Vendors have started adopting OCPP 2.0.0 widely now. With the release of OCPP 2.0.1, the EV industry has a robust and future-ready protocol, offering significant improvements over its predecessor, OCPP 1.6. In this blog post, we’ll explore what OCPP 2.0.0 is, why it’s essential, and how it works using a sample implementation of it.

item.title: EV Charging: Thanks to Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP) üöó
item.description:
EV Charging: Thanks to Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP) üöó

The electric vehicle (EV) revolution is gaining momentum, with more and more drivers making the switch to cleaner transportation. But alongside the growing number of EVs comes the need for a robust and standardized charging infrastructure. This is where the Open Charge Point Protocol (OCPP) comes in. In this blog post, we’ll explore what OCPP is, why it’s essential, and how it works.

item.title: Free SSL certificates using Cert manager and Let‚Äôs Encrypt üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
item.description:
Free SSL certificates using Cert manager and Let‚Äôs Encrypt üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Securing web traffic with SSL/TLS certificates is essential for protecting data privacy and maintaining trust with users. In Kubernetes environments, managing SSL certificates manually can be cumbersome and error-prone. However, with tools like Cert Manager and Let‚Äôs Encrypt, obtaining and renewing SSL certificates can be automated, ensuring seamless encryption for your applications. In this blog post, we’ll explore how Cert Manager and Let‚Äôs Encrypt work together to provide automatic SSL certificate management in Kubernetes.

item.title: Ingress and Load Balancer binding in bare-metal KubernetesüöÄ
item.description:
Ingress and Load Balancer binding in bare-metal KubernetesüöÄ

In our previous post we have seen how we can add MetalLB to our bare-metal Kubernetes. It helps us with a single point of contact between client network and cluster.

MetalLB helps for load-balancing external services we can combine it with an ingress controller, to provide a stateful layer between the network and the services.

item.title: MetalLB as a Load Balancer Service for On-Premises Kubernetes üé°
item.description:
MetalLB as a Load Balancer Service for On-Premises Kubernetes üé°

Unlike cloud providers that offer built-in load balancers, on-premises Kubernetes clusters often lack this functionality out-of-the-box. In this guide, we’ll walk through the process of configuring MetalLB as a load balancer service for your on-premises Kubernetes cluster, enabling you to distribute traffic to your applications effectively.

item.title: Installation of some common tools in Onpremise Kubernetes üè≥
item.description:
Installation of some common tools in Onpremise Kubernetes üè≥

In this guide, we’ll walk through the process of installing tools like Helm, Metallb, Ingress Controller, Keycloak, Jenkins in Kubernetes (Ubuntu).

item.title: Installing Kubernetes on Ubuntu: A Step-by-Step Guide üõ≥
item.description:
Installing Kubernetes on Ubuntu: A Step-by-Step Guide üõ≥

Kubernetes has become the de facto standard for container orchestration, enabling organizations to deploy, scale, and manage containerized applications with ease. In this guide, we’ll walk through the process of installing Kubernetes on Ubuntu, one of the most popular Linux distributions.

item.title: Uploading Docker Image from WSL 2 to AWS ECR üö¢
item.description:
Uploading Docker Image from WSL 2 to AWS ECR üö¢

In this post, we’ll walk through the process of uploading a Docker image from Windows Subsystem for Linux 2 (WSL 2) to Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) on AWS. Docker has become a cornerstone technology for containerizing applications, and AWS ECR provides a managed container registry service for storing, managing, and deploying Docker container images.

item.title: Setting Up WSL 2 and Installing Docker Engine on Windows ‚ùÑ
item.description:
Setting Up WSL 2 and Installing Docker Engine on Windows ‚ùÑ

In this post, we’ll explore how to enable WSL 2 in Windows machine. Once WSL 2 enabled, we will check how we can install docker engine and run a container using that.

item.title: Hosting Hugo generated site in Github üåä
item.description:
Hosting Hugo generated site in Github üåä

In this post, we’ll explore how to create a website using Hugo, a static site generator, and host it on GitHub Pages. We’ll also integrate the GitHub-style theme for a sleek and modern look.
